page.title: 08LILLESHALL WEATHER STATION.
page.content: In{Lilleshall}Village is a{weather {station}manned by Mr. John Warner.His equipment is mainly expensive computers and sophisticated monitoring apparatus. Half his time is spent at the weather station. He works for {Beacon Radio}and the{Shropshire Star forecasting for the next day or as far as 6 days ahead. The highest temperature ever recorded in this area was 32C in July 1976. The coldest was 26C in January 1982. The average annual rainfall is 26 inches. In the winter he begins work at 6 a.m. He became interested in weather recordind during the abnormally{severe winter of {1947}when his school was closed. He joined the{Met.Office (R.A.F.Shawbury) in{1954}and had his first big equipment in{1957.
